text: The Duquesne Incline () is a funicular near Pittsburgh's South Side neighborhood. It travels to Mt. Washington in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States. Designed by Hungarian-American engineer Samuel Diescher, the incline was completed in 1877. The lower station is in the Second Empire style. Together with the incline, which rises in height. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1975. It is a very popular tourist attraction in Pittsburgh. ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Pennsylvania Category:Pittsburgh
title: Duquesne Incline
